TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Hi, Is anyone using Tantares and Tantares LV with RO/RSS/RP-0?

I noticed there are configs in the pack and I'm thinking of starting a new KSP game and just wondering how it worked

The configs are slightly outdated, and I haven't tried RP-0 at all, since the new version of configs should be incorporated "officially" into RO itself. But I can upload the updated version at Dropbox for the sake of having an easier migration.

The configs are slightly outdated, and I haven't tried RP-0 at all, since the new version of configs should be incorporated "officially" into RO itself. But I can upload the updated version at Dropbox for the sake of having an easier migration.

Oh thanks if it wouldn't be too much trouble...otherwise I can just muddle through..I assume the next RO update will have them anyway from what your saying.

Thank you! Indeed it is, feels really weird playing without clouds and kerbals that all look alike.

Looking good, have really been looking forward to IVAs.

I'm glad

Yes, I love that particular pack, the Kerbal faces are the best available. Sadly I don't have the RAM to spare anymore...

hmmm its tempting to simply wait for 1.0, import the IVA, strip it to the walls and then rebuild it the way I want it, but it wouldn't be ethical. OTOH, importing the lab into Blender would allow me to position windows in the correct places...

I'd cautiously say that it is perfectly ethical, as long as you maintain where the original models came from. I'd perfectly welcome anyone to convert and alter my own models (See Tantares+).

Kind of an aside - Re-positioning windows on an already textured model would be a new definition of hell, IMO.

I think you would have a much easier time starting from scratch than trying to work backwards from the vertical version.

Fashion advice...

Kliper - Nero o grigio?

Edited March 29, 2015 by Beale

Fashion advice...

Kliper - Nero o grigio?

http://puu.sh/gUhP7/f73ad5ceb8.jpg http://puu.sh/gUhTu/d5c7ef9f4a.jpg

Noir, mon ami.

Grey is your "style", I know, but I prefer black ablative shielding.

Fashion advice...

Kliper - Nero o grigio?

http://puu.sh/gUhP7/f73ad5ceb8.jpg http://puu.sh/gUhTu/d5c7ef9f4a.jpg

I don't speak, read or write Russian, but I assume that Nero means "left-hand picture" in this context, so I say Nero.

Kind of an aside - Re-positioning windows on an already textured model would be a new definition of hell, IMO.

Then maybe I should tell you right away that the windows on the PPTS could be a bit larger.

Noir, mon ami.

This.

Noir, mon ami.

Grey is your "style", I know, but I prefer black ablative shielding.

Merci!

I'm willing to throw my style out the window a bit for the Kliper, since it is so different, so black is fine

There is another take where the split between the panels are white, but that walks a little too far from stock for me!

I don't speak, read or write Russian, but I assume that Nero means "left-hand picture" in this context, so I say Nero.

Nero is not Russian, it is a word from the best language.

It means black. And I retract my statement, to not start a language war.

Thanks for the feedback!

Then maybe I should tell you right away that the windows on the PPTS could be a bit larger.

This.

For the Kliper that's fine (Same with the PPTS actually) as they are separate meshes, so easy to resize.

It's more difficult with the Gemini for example, where the windows are actually built into the mesh (And this is always the case on IVA models).

Edited March 29, 2015 by Beale
Black shielding is awesome! But unity will make this purple and that's sad.

It just occurred to me that I can use the PPTS to somewhat fuffill my dream of having a Dragon V1 in this pack! The PPTS is a little longer and has the strange protrusion on one side, but they are similar in all other ways. I don't think a cargo trunk would be too hard to make with other parts.
Maybe grigio with kewl hexa-shaped thingies like on the Vostok could work?

Black shielding is awesome! But unity will make this purple and that's sad.

Huh? I've not come across this bug!

It just occurred to me that I can use the PPTS to somewhat fuffill my dream of having a Dragon V1 in this pack! The PPTS is a little longer and has the strange protrusion on one side, but they are similar in all other ways. I don't think a cargo trunk would be too hard to make with other parts.

I love to see creative uses for these parts!

Curtquarquesso made a "Drakon" spacecraft in his .craft pack, which is almost a carbon-copy of the Dragon V1, it uses the VA capsule. Might be worth to check out

Maybe grigio with kewl hexa-shaped thingies like on the Vostok could work?

That could be nice!

I'm unsure about the "panelling" on the underside of the body. That could be a place for more ablative-looking shielding.

New Soyuz IVA,

I think better than the last one. But, still unfinished (Yeah, that's a green console).
Are there any download mirrors? I don't have access to downloaded pack right now, and Kerbal Stuff is SLOW (Don't know why, but it's definitely KS' problem, not mine).

http://puu.sh/gUlyA/53d1bfec5e.jpg

Yay.

Are there any download mirrors? I don't have access to downloaded pack right now, and Kerbal Stuff is SLOW (Don't know why, but it's definitely KS' problem, not mine).

I'm afraid not, I chose to channel all downloads through Kerbal Stuff because I love to see the download ticker climb, like a point hoarding goblin.

So... The latest mirror I can offer you is of version ~10, which I'm sure you don't want.

Kerbal Stuff is working great for myself, maybe try a VPN?

It's kinda sad that there is no mirror. Gonna wait, then...

Yay.

The magic of the iterative design process!

Many thanks for keeping up with these

The sense of scale in KSP has always been strange to me. The Mk 1-2 pod is respectively a large pod, yet it's interior spaces dont seem to match up with how large it is on the outside. With Tantares, everything adds up nicely.

Hey beale, i wonder if it's possible to add a 3 person Soyuz pod version for later missions?

I really like the idea of the 2 person being the benchmark, but could you add a 3 person version aswell?

But it has it's downside: it's more expensive and heavier than the 2 person one.

Great IVA!

Hey beale, i wonder if it's possible to add a 3 person Soyuz pod version for later missions?

I really like the idea of the 2 person being the benchmark, but could you add a 3 person version aswell?

But it has it's downside: it's more expensive and heavier than the 2 person one.

Thanks!

3-person, I really would like to. But it really is a question of space.

a 3-seat layout like the real Soyuz would not be possible, not enough horizontal width. An extra Kerbal "hanging from the roof" would be possible, though it might look a bit strange...

So for the time being, it's a LOK capsule, 2 seater

Anyway!

Tantares 19
